title: Gentleman Tahm Kench Skin Concept
body:
Hi all, here's a skin I designed that I think really suits Tahm. Heh, _suits._ 

The core idea was to turn Tahm into a more bewhiskered, dapper gentleman than usual. I looked at white-tie dress and catfish for my main inspiration, and tried to incorporate an ornate, art nouveau inspired shell design for his markings. 
I designed this with a theoretical 750 RP price point in mind.

I worked on this before the nifty Urf Kench skin was previewed on the PBE, now it's out I can see the blue skin colour I chose here is awkwardly similar! But instead of shelving the concept I thought I'd put it out there and share it for feedback. 
C&C very welcome! 

http://orig12.deviantart.net/4fbc/f/2016/067/b/c/gentleman_tahm_kench___skin_concept_by_fivetinsoldiers-d9udmax.png

replies.body: I must say this is an ingenious illumination to ignite the imagination. Mr Kench is just the fastidious fish to frequent the most formal of functions both fine and fancy. I particularly appreciate the pale patterning present on both his pate and posterior. Bravo I say.

>
> uwotm8

Sometimes, Rioters are full of crap.  I thought I was being clear. ;)

{{sticker:slayer-jinx-wink}}
I thank you thoroughly, Kindlejack, for your kind comments concerning the construction of my costume concept for this classy Kench character!

Something we work on which might be of help if you are looking to further your artistic skill is blending hues on materials. If the skin is cool where the light hits it we put some warmth into the shadows. If a material is black we'll make decisions about how to subtly colour it with greens, blues and browns. Generally putting a lot of rich colour, and multiple colours, into gradients. Particularly on skin where subsurface scattering can make the terminator point of light extremely saturated. Studying from photographs or classical paintings can really help wrap your head around colour!

I really appreciate the pointers, it's great to hear what I can work on to improve. I do find the colour theory behind shadows and terminators a little tough at the moment, so this critique hits home. I know I have a lot of work to do! Tahm's missing that colour richness and variation you described in his suit here. Looking forward to studying up and coming back to the boards with some new concepts. Thanks again!
Thanks for enjoying League of Legends and coming up with a great concept >:D

can you mae others aswel? like mecha tahm kech ? like his mouth is a blender and that kind of idea, or a woods guardian version like leblanc or heckarim has one, the top hat in this case i thoug it could be a mushroom i just love that champion in all aspect would like to buy him a good 1825 rp skin that could be worth it.

damn son, that was finer a fiddle with sticks! I am much obliged to render your hypothesis.

Fuck that rigmarole. Viktor skin pls. Downvote if you agree (one step ahead of you Weebs).
I really think this is cool and would be beautiful in game what would his passive stacks be?
Maybe a Tuxedo? The first stack is a tuxedo top. The second is a big top hat, and the third is a big red tie in the middle. It would look dapper as hell.
Well if it would cost 750 RP like the OP suggested, there would be no new effects.
my question is what would a tahm skin that cost 1350 be like...what particles/extra effects can they add to him...
Another name for this is "Recently Washed Tahm Kench".

I know he already has a wicked VO, but replacing it with one similar to Cho's for this Skin would be hilarious. I really think they should have went above and beyond and made Gnars a Legendary skin with a new VO as well (or well, I guess a VO to begin with since Gnar doesn't really have one xD) to fit Cho's. 

A trio of gentlemen walking around saying, "Hmm, quite." And so on, would be hysterical :P
I really like this concept. Personally I don't care for his Master Chef or Urf skins, but I think this would be a great addition, great work!

I like the idea and the way you presented it but I doubt it'll actually happen :(

its not a very far cry from his original skin of his somewhat hobo-gentleman them.

I definitely hear you on that. I initially felt it would be a good theme for him because of his somewhat gentlemanly personality and wanted to push that further, but this concept may not be far enough away from the experience of playing classic Tahm.  Certainly something for me to think about. 
I really appreciate the critique, thanks!

This is really really good. I love the patterns on him, they look so fancy! Personally, I think if they ever made this skin, then they should make his teeth whiter and more straight so he looks more gentlemanly. :) I love the monocle! And the curly mustache is awesome!

Good idea, I'll try whitening his front teeth a little to give him an improved sparkling smile. 
Thanks for the feedback Squidblimp! (That's a great name by the way.)
I think his tux would get a little dirty during his ult..
He'd need to spend most of his gold on dry cleaning. :(
i didnt like urf kench ='(, but damn this is awesome, love this as much as i love the car salesman tahm kench

Beautiful art, you put a respectably amazing amount of effort into this! I made a similar concept a while back to try and get him a Lickilicky-esque skin, so I've got my fingers crosssed that pink's the color they'll go with with this kind of theme.

I think it should be the same price with **Gentleman Cho'Gath** , which means 1820 RP.
